sentences.sContent: games suitable for specific age groups

sentences.sContent: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.sCn: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

sentences.sContent: ...organizations increasingly use “team” as a verb rather than a noun: they form teams for specific purposes and then quickly disband them...
...Apart from the specific trends highlighted above...
...When you can quote a specific number like a fifth of the patients were able to quit...
...It is the characteristics of the specific environment they are in...
...We judge a potential partner according to our specific cultural expectations about what romantic love should feel like...
...These companies recruit all over the country and the globe for workers with specific abilities...
...although the test could not be more specific than somewhere between eastern Oregon and western Wyoming...
...I don’t think there is a specific rule about how to beat stress...

trans.tranOther: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
